content:
Sure, here are some suggestions for font pairings that work well together:

1. Serif and Sans-Serif: pairing a serif font with a sans-serif font creates a classic, clean look. For example, pairing Georgia with Open Sans or Times New Roman with Arial. 2. Sans-Serif and Script: pairing a sans-serif font with a script font can create a contrast between modern and classic styles. For example, pairing Montserrat with Pacifico or Futura with Playlist Script. 3. Sans-Serif and Display: pairing a sans-serif font with a display font can create a bold, attention-grabbing look. For example, pairing Roboto with Bungee or Lato with Raleway Dots. 4. Serif and Display: pairing a serif font with a display font can create a vintage, elegant look. For example, pairing Playfair Display with Abril Fatface or Baskerville with Bodoni. Remember to experiment with different combinations to find what works best for your website and brand. It's also important to consider legibility and readability when pairing fonts.
